dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Rizwan b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz c Mohammad Rizwan b Shaheen Shah Afridi 151 (151b 14x4 3x6 197m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Curtains to Gurbaz's knock! Afridi walks up to him straightaway to congratulate him. Rizwan also runs up to him and pats his back. End of a magnificent innings. Backs away to give himself some room and go over the off side. But only gets a thick outside edge to the length ball to the wicketkeeper. A run-a-ball 151 but is that enough for Afghanistan? Gets a hug from Rashid Khan, who walks in next

dismissalText.long: run out (Shaheen Shah Afridi)
dismissalText.commentary: Shahidullah run out (Shaheen Shah Afridi) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Bull's eye! Full length ball outside off, Shahidullah pushes it towards the off side and sets off, aborts seeing Afridi get to the ball. But Nabi was well down the track and he ended up sacrificing himself. Never a run there. Afridi turns, aims, throws in a single motion and does not miss

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Fazalhaq Farooqi
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Fazalhaq Farooqi 53 (66b 6x4 0x6 86m) SR: 80.3

dismissalComment.html: Big wicket for Farooqi. Length ball on the pads, angling in to the right-hander, 131.8kmph, Babar goes for a half-hearted flick towards mid-on or he is too early to the shot and Shahidi runs back and completes the catch to dismiss the Pakistan captain. Big breakthrough. Can Afghanistan bounce back into the game?

dismissalComment.html: Nabi strikes now. Change of bowling worked for Afghanistan. Agha goes for an unwanted reverse sweep to a full ball outside off, doesn't time it well and ends up top edging it to keeper

Two wickets in an over for Nabi. Length ball around off stump, Usama Mir comes down the track and heaves it across the line to deep midwicket where the fielder takes a comfortable catch. Experiment to promote Usama up the order didn't work for Pakistan here

dismissalText.long: run out (Fazalhaq Farooqi)
dismissalText.commentary: Shadab Khan run out (Fazalhaq Farooqi) 48 (35b 3x4 1x6 55m) SR: 137.14

dismissalComment.html: Farooqi has run Shadab out backing up!. Afghanistan are celebrating but Shadab waits. Farooqi runs in from over the wicket but does not bowl and before he gets into his delivery stride, Shadab was out of the crease. Fair dismissal, the TV umpire agrees. What a way for Shadab to walk out, shakes his head as he does so
49.1 actual ball - Naseem hits and hits well! Full and on off, it is the slower one and he is deep in his crease. Lofts it and beats long-off to his left

commentTextItems.html: Naseem does it again! Against Afghanistan. In a thriller! He is off. he helmet and bat fly away and he runs off. Gets a full ball around off from around the stumps, he looks to flick it away but gets a thick outside edge well past short third. How do Pakistan do this again and again?

commentPostTextItems.html: What a humdinger of a game that went down to the last over and had everything. Pakistan might have sealed the series but there is one more game to go on Saturday and we will be right here as always brining all the action live. Till then, it's a goodnight from us!

Babar Azam: All credit to the boys. We just tried to build the partnership when me and Imam were playing, just wanted to play long and see where we stand after 40 overs. We knew we could chase 80 or 90 in the last 10 overs. Naseem also comes up in crunch situations. [Batting against spin] I always try to improve. Can never be satisfied. We see different quality of bowling. I am never worried about my skills and just back my skills at all times. All focus on the last match

Hashmatullah Shahidi, the Afghanistan captain: It is hurting because we had enough runs but at the last moment they took the game away from us. The over which...49th over there were some easy balls to the batsman and they smashed it. They [openers] are playing very good from one and half years. I want them to play the same way. Both are good sides. The pressure, we weren't able to control.

Shadab Khan is the Player of the Match: When you are a senior player, you go through these stages every time. I try to be as calm as possible. The pitch was...their players have worked class spinners, so I wanted to take on fast bowlers. The boundaries were long. My plan was to go for two's. After that shot [against Zimbabwe at the World Cup], we lost the game. I was blaming myself. For me, that was a crucial moment.

11:28pm Pakistan were set up in the chase with a 52-run opening stand between Fakhar and Imam before the former fell. But Imam, in the company of Babar, almost set up the perfect platform with a 118-run second-wicket partnership. But the wicket of the Pakistan captain opened familiar wounds for them as they collapsed steadily. In the end, it was down to Shadab keeping his cool and almost taking them to the doorstep with the couple of shots in the penultimate over off Rahman, who had a real off day.

Ahmad : "Don't need Asif Ali when you have Naseem shah. This is the beauty of cricket 8hrs of game and comes down to the last ball and the number 10th. At 20 years old I feel I might get a heart attack being a pct fan."
Adil RK: "Naseem vs Farooqi, a better love story then TWILIGHT. Naseem - 2 , Farooqi - 0"

11:24pm Pakistan have had a jail-break and narrowly escape losing to Afghanistan in an ODI for the first time. And as the players shake hands, Babar has a few words with Nabi. Perhaps about the Shadab run-out? Never a dull moment with Pakistan in action, eh!

They were down and out when Shadab marshalled the lower order. And perhaps were gone when Shadab was run-out backing up. But Naseem once again did the unthinkable. Afghanistan cannot believe they have bottled this up. Gurbaz is seen mouthing a few words as he makes his way off the field. A fantastic 151 ends up on the losing side

commentTextItems.html: Oh the drama! Slower full one on off, he slogged it to the on side. Deep midwicket was running to his right but was done in by the ball spinning away. Fortunately for him, Noor, the sub, was running to his left, dives and saves the boundary
Fuller outside off, gets an inside edge to the on side

Farooqi runs in from over the wicket but does not bowl and before he gets into his delivery stride, Shadab was out of the crease. Fair dismissal, the TV umpire agrees. What a way for Shadab to walk out, shakes his head as he does so
49.1 actual ball - Naseem hits and hits well! Full and on off, it is the slower one and he is deep in his crease. Lofts it and beats long-off to his left
Gone the distance! A juicy full toss on middle and leg - is that over waist height? Shadab stands still and deposits over deep square leg. Looked high in real time but wasn't given a no-ball
